features.featureTitle:
Replace the single shared Category options list with two separate, alphabetically-sorted dropdown category lists: one for Expense entries and one for Saving entries.

Expense categories (A–Z): AK Expenses, EB Bill, Internet Bill, Mobile Bill, Online Shopping, Snacks.
Saving categories (A–Z): FD, PPF, RD, SIP, Saving Box.

Expose these lists via the existing category constants module so all category dropdowns read from the same source of truth.

Update the Add New Entry form so Category is mandatory and uses two separate dropdowns based on the selected Type:
- When Type is Expense, show only the Expense category dropdown.
- When Type is Saving, show only the Saving category dropdown.

Ensure changing the Type resets/clears any previously selected Category if it is not valid for the newly selected Type.

Update all user-facing labels and validation messages in English (e.g., show “Category *” and prevent submission when no category is selected).

Update the Edit Entry dialog so Category is mandatory and uses two separate dropdowns based on the selected Type:
- When Type is Expense, show only the Expense category dropdown.
- When Type is Saving, show only the Saving category dropdown.

Ensure changing the Type resets/clears any previously selected Category if it is not valid for the newly selected Type, and block saving until a valid category is selected.

Remove black-colored text from the UI by eliminating explicit black text styling (e.g., `text-black`, inline `#000`, or equivalent) and ensure text colors consistently use theme-driven foreground/muted-foreground tokens so they contrast clearly against the existing saving-money background image and overlay.

If needed, adjust theme variables and/or overlay opacity so default text is readable across pages (Dashboard, Entries, Download APK, and sign-in screen).
